revised_title: Application of Fourier's Double Integrals to Optical Problems
tldr: The authors explore the application of Fourier's double integrals to optical problems, demonstrating how this method can represent a wide class of functions in terms of circular functions. They apply this process to various problems, including the radiation of an incandescent gas, Rontgen rays, and the effect of radiative damping on molecular vibrations in widening spectrum lines.
